item.title: ナイト財団が「ナイト選挙ハブ」を発表、営利目的でない、あるいは年間売上が500万ドル以下のニュースルームに選挙ツールとサービスを提供（Barbara Allen/Poynter）
item.description:
Barbara Allen / Poynter:
The Knight Foundation debuts Knight Election Hub, offering election tools and services to newsrooms that are not for profit or have revenue less than $5M/year  —  The Knight Foundation rolled out its election hub Thursday and expects to add more resources in the coming months.

item.title: 内部メモ：ABCニュースのエグゼクティブ・エディター、ステイシア・デシシュクが同局を去り、35年のジャーナリズムのキャリアを閉じる（Jeremy Barr/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Jeremy Barr / Washington Post:
Internal memo: ABC News Executive Editor Stacia Deshishku is leaving the network and her 35-year career in journalism  —  Deshishku has served as executive editor since 2022, overseeing shows and editorial strategy.  —  ABC News executive editor Stacia Deshishku has decided to leave …

item.title: ロイター・インスティチュート：20カ国のオンラインニュース購読者の41％がフルプライスより安く払っていると回答、カナダでは54％、米国では46％が安く払っていると回答（Craig Robertson/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Craig Robertson / Nieman Lab:
Reuters Institute: across 20 countries, 41% of online news subscribers say they pay less than full price; 54% in Canada and 46% in the US say they pay less  —  Is increasing subscriber numbers by offering people rock-bottom trial prices sustainable?  —  It's no secret that news publishers …

item.title: 全米放送協会が他の54のメディア団体と共に、ジャーナリストの情報源とデータを保護するPRESS法の成立を米上院に要請（Inside Radio）
item.description:
Inside Radio:
The National Association of Broadcasters joins 54 other media organizations asking the US Senate to pass the PRESS Act to protect journalists' sources and data  —  Five months after the House of Representatives passed a bill that would prevent the government from compelling reporters …

item.description:
Janko Roettgers / Lowpass:
A look at an early development version of a smart TV app for Venu Sports, offering DVR functionality, a multiview feature, a large library, and more  —  Unannounced features include DVR recordings, multi-view video. … Venu Sports, the upcoming sports streaming service jointly run by Fox …

item.title: ウィル・ルイスとロブ・ウィネットが直面している疑惑は、英米どちらのジャーナリズム倫理にも反している。
item.description:
James Ball / Politico:
The allegations facing Will Lewis and Rob Winnett are not remotely in line with either UK or US journalism ethics; blaming British media culture is wrong  —  The allegations of journalistic misconduct facing publisher Will Lewis aren't condoned in the U.K. either.

item.title: 情報筋ディズニーはアップフロント市場で全体的なコミットメントを獲得するためにDisney+の広告CPMレートを引き下げ、ライバルはディズニーのレートに見合うか心配（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Sources: Disney is lowering ad CPM rates for Disney+ in a bid to win overall commitments during the upfront market; rivals fret about matching Disney's rates  —  In a bid to win overall commitments, Disney has been striking deals that call for significant “rollbacks” in the rates it charges …

item.title: 情報源ソニーがクイーンの音楽カタログ（ライブを除く）を10億ポンドで取得、ディズニーは米国とカナダの録音音楽権を保持（Jem Aswad/Variety
item.description:
Jem Aswad / Variety:
Sources: Sony is acquiring Queen's music catalog, excluding live performances, for £1B; Disney retains recorded music rights in the US and Canada  —  The Queen music catalog, along with a number of other rights, is in the process of being acquired by Sony Music for £1 billion …

item.title: フランス人ジャーナリストは、インドが取材許可証の更新を拒否し、今週退去を余儀なくされ、2024年にインドを離れる3人目のジャーナリストとなったと語った（Eltaf Najafizada/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Eltaf Najafizada / Bloomberg:
A French journalist says India refused to renew his journalism permit and forced him to leave this week, making him the third journalist to leave India in 2024  —  India has allegedly refused to renew a French correspondent's permit, making him the third journalist to leave India this year …

item.title: Spotify、Spotify for Podcastersホスティングに登録したクリエイターだけでなく、すべてのポッドキャスターが動画をアップロードできるように。
item.description:
Lauren Forristal / TechCrunch:
Spotify now lets all podcasters upload videos, rather than only creators who signed up to Spotify for Podcasters hosting; Spotify has 250K+ video podcasts  —  Spotify is now letting non-hosted podcasters upload videos to the platform.  The company quietly rolled out the new feature last week …

item.title: 内戦や紛争で国外に逃れたエチオピアのジャーナリストへのインタビュー。
item.description:
Committee to Protect Journalists:
Interviews with Ethiopian journalists who fled the country due to civil war and conflict and who remain in exile, sometimes struggling to afford food and rent  —  When Belete Kassa's friend and news show co-host Belaye Manaye was arrested in November 2023 and taken to the remote Awash Arba military camp known …

item.title: TPMのジョシュ・マーシャルへのインタビュー。サイトの歴史、様々な収益モデル、政治ジャーナリズムの経済学がいかに「両サイド」のフレーミングにつながるかについて（Rick Perlstein/American Prospect）。
item.description:
Rick Perlstein / American Prospect:
An interview with TPM's Josh Marshall, on the site's history, various revenue models, and how political journalism's economics can lead to “both-sides” framing  —  The book I'm working on now is about how the last 25 years of American politics brought our democratic republic to the brink of collapse.

item.title: ネットフリックス、東南アジアで現地制作を強化、米ライバルの撤退で新規加入者獲得へ、2023年の売上に占めるアジア太平洋地域の割合はわずか11％（Sohee Kim/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Sohee Kim / Bloomberg:
Netflix ramps up local production in Southeast Asia to attract new subscribers as US rivals pull back; Asia Pacific accounted for just ~11% of its 2023 revenue  —  - Streaming giant is backing big-budget shows in Indonesia  — Thai production rises to 10 titles this year, from six in 2023

item.title: WBEZとシカゴ・サンタイムズの組合員記者たちが、4月のレイオフ後、シカゴ・パブリック・メディアのマット・ムーグCEOの即時解任を求める圧倒的な票を投じた。
item.description:
WBEZ:
Unionized journalists at WBEZ and the Chicago Sun-Times voted overwhelmingly for Chicago Public Media CEO Matt Moog's immediate removal, after layoffs in April  —  Unions for the Chicago Sun-Times and WBEZ criticized Matt Moog, who announced he planned to leave last year but later oversaw layoffs.

item.title: カンヌでXのリンダ・ヤカリノCEOは、NWSLのシリーズ「The Offseason」のようなドキュメンタリーの制作について、スポーツリーグと話し合っていると語った（Kerry Flynn/Axios）
item.description:
Kerry Flynn / Axios:
At Cannes, X CEO Linda Yaccarino says the platform is in conversations with sports leagues about producing more docuseries, like the NWSL series The Offseason  —  - About 70% of the conversation ahead of the Paris Olympics this summer is about women's teams, she added.
